result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa B Basilio Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of 7/10/17 status hearing sent to defendant at 1933 Bairds St., Madison, WI 53713 - "Return to Sender,moved, no address, Unable to Forward."
Exhibit 2 presented and identified as items brought back in the shopping cart.
Exh. 1 presented and identified as document prepared for the Columbus P.D. (List of Losses)

Called at 11:15, Defendant Melissa B Basilio Ruiz in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim called and sworn, manager at Dollar General Store, Columbus. Direct examination by DA Kohlwey. Exh. 1 presented and identified as document prepared for the Columbus P.D. (List of Losses). Exhibit 2 presented and identified as items brought back in the shopping cart. DA Kohlwey notes $75 of returned goods were able to be sold, rest not. State moved Exh. 1&2. No objection from the defense. Court received.  Cross examination by Atty. Benavides. State called Lt. Weiner, Columbus P.D., sworn in. Direct by DA Kohlwey. Cross examination.  Atty. Benavides called Defendant, sworn. Direct examination taken. Cross examination by DA Kohlwey. Redirect by Atty. Benavides. Court noted once items taken, defendant is responsible for them. Court found $578.55 restitution owed. Court found defendant able to pay a minimum of $25 per month.  Court adjourned at 11:56 a.m.
Restitution hearing on December 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Notice of August 3 plea and sentence sent so defendant at 1933  Baird St., MAdison, WI 53713 "Return to Sender, moved, left no address, Unable to Forward."
Status hearing on July 10, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Restitution hearing on November 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

2:09 P.M., Defendant Melissa B Basilio Ruiz in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in recess at 2:11 P.M. to review PSI, Court back in session at 2:21 P.M., appearances the same, Counsel has received PSI, Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 1 year, $453.00 costs, Restitution Hearing to be set, continue counseling recommendations by DOC, maintain absolute sobriety, maintain full time employment/schooling, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 9 month probation review hearing, Ct. 2, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, concurrent to Ct. 1, 3 months jail w/Huber, Huber for work and treatment, to be served w/in first year of probation, Jail start date to be determined by Agent, may serve sentence in Dane County, continue counseling recommendations by DOC, absolute sobriety, maintain full time employment/schooling, $268.00 costs, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, no use of controlled substances w/out valid prescription, 9 month probation review, 1 day sentence credit, 2:54 P.M.
